data.title: Tokyo Trial Season 1 Streaming: Watch & Stream Online via Netflix
data.meta_description: Stream Tokyo Trial Season 1 online and dive into the gripping story of 11 judges in a post-WWII international trial of Japanese war criminals.
data.meta_site_name: ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More
data.text:
Looking to stream Tokyo Trial Season 1 online? We have all the information you need. Tokyo Trial is a 2016 political drama series directed by Pieter Verhoeff and Rob W. King. This series is an international co-production involving Japanese public broadcaster NHK, Dutch studio FATT Productions, and Canadian producers David Cormican and Don Carmody.

Here’s how you can watch and stream Tokyo Trial Season 1 via streaming services such as Netflix.

Is Tokyo Trial Season 1 available to watch via streaming?

Yes, Tokyo Trial Season 1 is available to watch via streaming on Netflix.

Tokyo Trial intricately portrays the deliberations of 11 Allied judges as they navigate the complex legal and moral dimensions of the post-World War II era. With tension mounting, the trial serves as a pivotal moment in history, grappling with justice, accountability, and the legacy of war crimes. Through compelling storytelling, the series delves into the intricate web of political, cultural, and legal dynamics shaping the aftermath of the conflict.

Tokyo Trial’s cast includes Tim Ahern, Serge Hazanavicius, Jonathan Hyde, Julian Wadham, Stephen McHattie, David K.S. Tse, Bert Matias, Kęstutis Jakštas, William Hope, Hadewych Minis, Michael Ironside, Irrfan Khan, Marcel Hensema, Paul Freeman, Petras Kuneika, and Masato Tanno. Stacy Keach is the narrator of all episodes. Rob W. King, who co-directed the series also wrote all episodes of the show with Max Mannix and Kees van Beijnum.

Watch Tokyo Trial Season 1 streaming via Netflix

Tokyo Trial Season 1 is available to watch on Netflix. It is an OTT platform that offers a variety of streaming content ranging from action blockbusters to romantic comedies. Netflix content includes both originals like Black Mirror and Damsel as well as productions from other companies present on the platform via streaming deals such as Breaking Bad and The Matrix.

You can watch via Netflix by following these steps:

Visit netflix.com/signup

Choose a payment plan from the following:

$6.99 per month (standard with Ads)

$15.49 per month (Standard)

$22.99 per month (Premium)

Enter your email address and password to create an account

Enter your chosen payment method

The cheapest Netflix Standard with Ads Plan provides all but a few of its movies and TV shows. However, it will show ads before or during most of its content. You can watch in Full HD and on two supported devices at a time.

Its Standard Plan provides the same but is completely ad-free while also allowing users to download content on two supported devices with an additional option to add one extra member who doesn’t live in the same household.

The Premium Plan provides the same as above, though for four supported devices at a time, with content displaying in Ultra HD. Users get to download content on up to six supported devices at a time and have the option to add up to two extra members who don’t live in the same household. Netflix spatial audio is also supported.

Tokyo Trial’s synopsis is as follows:

“In the wake of World War II, 11 Allied judges are tasked with weighing the fates of Japanese war criminals in a tense international trial.”

NOTE: The streaming services listed above are subject to change. The information provided was correct at the time of writing.
